title: How to Fold a Towel Swan

steps.headline: Lay a bath towel flat.
steps.description: Be sure to orient it in the “landscape” position as shown below.

steps.headline: Fold the top two corners downwards and inwards so that they meet in the center.
steps.description: Note that, since it's not a perfect square, they won't line up with the bottom edge of the towel.

steps.headline: Roll the two outside edges inwards toward the center.
steps.description: The resulting shape should like an upwards-pointing arrow.

steps.headline: Fold the resulting arrow in to a Z.
steps.description: Be sure that the two bottom points of the arrow end up at the bottom of the Z and the top point, at the top.

steps.headline: Set the Z down and squeeze the corners to set the curves.
steps.description: The Z should now look like a swan.

steps.headline: Repeat for a swan companion whose neck can complete a heart shape.

text: Lay a bath towel flat. Be sure to orient it in the “landscape” position as shown below. Fold the top two corners downwards and inwards so that they meet in the center. Note that, since it's not a perfect square, they won't line up with the bottom edge of the towel. Roll the two outside edges inwards toward the center. The resulting shape should like an upwards-pointing arrow. Fold the resulting arrow in to a Z. Be sure that the two bottom points of the arrow end up at the bottom of the Z and the top point, at the top. Set the Z down and squeeze the corners to set the curves. The Z should now look like a swan. Repeat for a swan companion whose neck can complete a heart shape.
